verses.kjv: Then said the LORD unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind could not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.
verses.web: Then LORD said to me, “Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind would not turn toward this people. Cast them out of my sight, and let them go out!
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to me, "Even if Moses and Samuel were standing before me and pleading for these people, my heart would not go out to them. Send them away from my presence. Let them go."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the LORD; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.
verses.web: It will happen, when they ask you, ‘Where shall we go out?’ then you shall tell them, ‘LORD says: “Such as are for death, to death; such as are for the sword, to the sword; such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for captivity, to captivity.” ’
verses.ct: When they ask you, 'Where should we go?' tell them this is what the LORD says: "Those marked for death will go to death. Those marked for the sword will go to the sword. Those marked for famine will go to famine. Those marked for captivity will go to captivity."

verses.kjv: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the LORD: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.
verses.web: “I will appoint over them four kinds,” says LORD: “the sword to kill, the dogs to tear, the birds of the sky, and the animals of the earth, to devour and to destroy.
verses.ct: "I will send 4 kinds of destruction against them," declares the LORD. "The sword to kill them, dogs to drag away their bodies, birds of the sky to feed on them, and wild animals to devour what's left."

verses.kjv: And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
verses.web: I will cause them to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "I will make them an object of horror to every kingdom on earth — all because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?
verses.web: For who will have pity on you, Jerusalem? Who will mourn you? Who will come to ask of your welfare?
verses.ct: "Who will feel sorry for you, Jerusalem? Who will mourn for you? Who will even stop to ask how you're doing?"

verses.kjv: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the LORD, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.
verses.web: You have rejected me,” says LORD. “You have gone backward. Therefore I have stretched out my hand against you and destroyed you. I am weary of showing compassion.
verses.ct: "You have rejected me," declares the LORD. "You keep turning your back on me. So I have raised my hand against you to destroy you. I am tired of holding back."

verses.kjv: And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they return not from their ways.
verses.web: I have winnowed them with a fan in the gates of the land. I have bereaved them of children. I have destroyed my people. They didn’t return from their ways.
verses.ct: "I have scattered them like chaff at the gates of the land. I have taken their children from them. I have destroyed my people because they refused to turn from their ways."

verses.kjv: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.
verses.web: Their widows are increased more than the sand of the seas. I have brought on them against the mother of the young men a destroyer at noonday. I have caused anguish and terrors to fall on her suddenly.
verses.ct: "Their widows have become more numerous than the sand of the seas. At midday I sent a destroyer against the mothers of young men, bringing sudden anguish and terror crashing down on them."

verses.kjv: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the LORD.
verses.web: She who has borne seven languishes. She has given up the spirit. Her sun has gone down while it was yet day. She has been disappointed and confounded. I will deliver their residue to the sword before their enemies,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "The mother who bore 7 sons grows faint — she breathes her last. Her sun has set while it's still daytime. She is left in shame and disgrace. As for those who survive, I will hand them over to the sword before their enemies," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them doth curse me.
verses.web: Woe is me, my mother, that you have borne me, a man of strife, and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have not lent, neither have men lent to me; yet every one of them curses me.
verses.ct: What misery, my mother, that you ever gave birth to me! The whole land treats me as an enemy. I haven't lent money to anyone or borrowed from anyone, yet everyone curses me.

verses.kjv: The LORD said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
verses.web: LORD said, “Most certainly I will strengthen you for good. Most certainly I will cause the enemy to make supplication to you in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
verses.ct: The LORD said, "I will surely strengthen you for a good purpose. I will make your enemies come begging to you in their time of disaster and distress."

verses.kjv: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?
verses.web: Can one break iron, even iron from the north, and bronze?
verses.ct: "Can anyone shatter iron — iron from the north — or bronze?"

verses.kjv: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
verses.web: I will give your substance and your treasures for a plunder without price, and that for all your sins, even in all your borders.
verses.ct: "Your wealth and your treasures I will hand over as plunder — given away for nothing — because of all the sins you've committed throughout your land."

verses.kjv: And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.
verses.web: I will make them to pass with your enemies into a land which you don’t know; for a fire is kindled in my anger, which will burn on you.”
verses.ct: "I will send you with your enemies into a land you've never known, because a fire has been kindled by my anger, and it will burn against you."

verses.kjv: O LORD, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.
verses.web: LORD, you know. Remember me, visit me, and avenge me of my persecutors. You are patient, so don’t take me away. Know that for your sake I have suffered reproach.
verses.ct: LORD, you know what I'm going through. Remember me and come to my aid. Take vengeance on those who persecute me. You are patient — don't let me be swept away. You know that I've endured insults for your sake.

verses.kjv: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O LORD God of hosts.
verses.web: Your words were found, and I ate them. Your words were to me a joy and the rejoicing of my heart, for I am called by your name, LORD, God of Armies.
verses.ct: When your words came to me, I devoured them. Your words filled my heart with joy and delight, because I bear your name, LORD, God of Armies.

verses.kjv: I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me with indignation.
verses.web: I didn’t sit in the assembly of those who make merry and rejoice. I sat alone because of your hand, for you have filled me with indignation.
verses.ct: I never sat around with people who were laughing and having a good time. I sat alone because your hand was on me, and you had filled me with your righteous anger.

verses.kjv: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, and as waters that fail?
verses.web: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuses to be healed? Will you indeed be to me as a deceitful brook, like waters that fail?
verses.ct: Why does my pain never end? Why is my wound beyond healing, refusing to get better? Will you turn out to be like a stream that dries up — like water that can't be counted on?

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says, “If you return, then I will bring you again, that you may stand before me; and if you take out the precious from the vile, you will be as my mouth. They will return to you, but you will not return to them.
verses.ct: So the LORD responded: "If you come back to me, I will restore you and let you stand in my presence again. If you speak what is worthy instead of what is worthless, you will be my spokesman. Let the people turn to you — but don't lower yourself to their level."

verses.kjv: And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I will make you to this people a fortified bronze wall. They will fight against you, but they will not prevail against you; for I am with you to save you and to deliver you,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "I will make you like a fortified wall of bronze to these people. They will fight against you, but they won't overcome you, because I am with you to rescue and deliver you," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
verses.web: “I will deliver you out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem you out of the hand of the terrible.”
verses.ct: "I will rescue you from the grip of the wicked and set you free from the clutches of the ruthless."
